uk.co.senab.bitmapcache

Class BitmapLruCache

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.co.senab.bitmapcache.BitmapLruCache

  • public class BitmapLruCache
extends java.lang.Object
    A cache which can be set to use multiple layers of caching for Bitmap objects in an Android app. Instances are created via a BitmapLruCache.Builder instance, which can be used to alter the settings of the resulting cache.

    Instances of this class should ideally be kept globally with the application, for example in the Application object. You should also use the bundled CacheableImageView wherever possible, as the memory cache has a closeStream relationship with it.

    Clients can call get(String) to retrieve a cached value from the given Url. This will check all available caches for the value. There are also the getFromDiskCache(String, android.graphics.BitmapFactory.Options) and getFromMemoryCache(String) which allow more granular access.

    There are a number of update methods. put(String, InputStream) and put(String, InputStream) are the preferred versions of the method, as they allow 1:1 caching to disk of the original content.
    put(String, Bitmap)} should only be used if you can't get access to the original InputStream.

    • Method Detail

      • contains

        public boolean contains(java.lang.String url)
        Returns whether any of the enabled caches contain the specified URL.

        If you have the disk cache enabled, you should not call this method from main/UI thread.

        Parameters:
        url - the URL to search for.
        Returns:
        true if any of the caches contain the specified URL, false otherwise.

      • containsInDiskCache

        public boolean containsInDiskCache(java.lang.String url)
        Returns whether the Disk Cache contains the specified URL. You should not call this method from main/UI thread.
        Parameters:
        url - the URL to search for.
        Returns:
        true if the Disk Cache is enabled and contains the specified URL, false otherwise.

      • containsInMemoryCache

        public boolean containsInMemoryCache(java.lang.String url)
        Returns whether the Memory Cache contains the specified URL. This method is safe to be called from the main thread.
        Parameters:
        url - the URL to search for.
        Returns:
        true if the Memory Cache is enabled and contains the specified URL, false otherwise.

      • get

        public CacheableBitmapDrawable get(java.lang.String url)
        Returns the value for url. This will check all caches currently enabled.

        If you have the disk cache enabled, you should not call this method from main/UI thread.

        Parameters:
        url - - String representing the URL of the image

      • get

        public CacheableBitmapDrawable get(java.lang.String url,
                          android.graphics.BitmapFactory.Options decodeOpts)
        Returns the value for url. This will check all caches currently enabled.

        If you have the disk cache enabled, you should not call this method from main/UI thread.

        Parameters:
        url - - String representing the URL of the image
        decodeOpts - - Options used for decoding the contents from the disk cache only.

      • getFromDiskCache

        public CacheableBitmapDrawable getFromDiskCache(java.lang.String url,
                                       android.graphics.BitmapFactory.Options decodeOpts)
        Returns the value for url in the disk cache only. You should not call this method from main/UI thread.

        If enabled, the result of this method will be cached in the memory cache.

        Unless you have a specific requirement to only query the disk cache, you should call get(String) instead.

        Parameters:
        url - - String representing the URL of the image
        decodeOpts - - Options used for decoding the contents from the disk cache.
        Returns:
        Value for url from disk cache, or null if the disk cache is not enabled.

      • getFromMemoryCache

        public CacheableBitmapDrawable getFromMemoryCache(java.lang.String url)
        Returns the value for url in the memory cache only. This method is safe to be called from the main thread.

        You should check the result of this method before starting a threaded call.

        Parameters:
        url - - String representing the URL of the image
        Returns:
        Value for url from memory cache, or null if the disk cache is not enabled.

      • put

        public CacheableBitmapDrawable put(java.lang.String url,
                          android.graphics.Bitmap bitmap)
        Caches bitmap for url into all enabled caches. If the disk cache is enabled, the bitmap will be compressed losslessly.

        If you have the disk cache enabled, you should not call this method from main/UI thread.

        Parameters:
        url - - String representing the URL of the image.
        bitmap - - Bitmap which has been decoded from url.
        Returns:
        CacheableBitmapDrawable which can be used to display the bitmap.

      • put

        public CacheableBitmapDrawable put(java.lang.String url,
                          android.graphics.Bitmap bitmap,
                          android.graphics.Bitmap.CompressFormat compressFormat,
                          int compressQuality)
        Caches bitmap for url into all enabled caches. If the disk cache is enabled, the bitmap will be compressed with the settings you provide.

        If you have the disk cache enabled, you should not call this method from main/UI thread.

        Parameters:
        url - - String representing the URL of the image.
        bitmap - - Bitmap which has been decoded from url.
        compressFormat - - Compression Format to use
        compressQuality - - Level of compression to use
        Returns:
        CacheableBitmapDrawable which can be used to display the bitmap.
        See Also:
        Bitmap.compress(Bitmap.CompressFormat, int, OutputStream)

      • put

        public CacheableBitmapDrawable put(java.lang.String url,
                          java.io.InputStream inputStream)
        Caches resulting bitmap from inputStream for url into all enabled caches. This version of the method should be preferred as it allows the original image contents to be cached, rather than a re-compressed version.

        The contents of the InputStream will be copied to a temporary file, then the file will be decoded into a Bitmap. Providing the decode worked:

        • If the memory cache is enabled, the decoded Bitmap will be cached to memory.
        • If the disk cache is enabled, the contents of the original stream will be cached to disk.

        You should not call this method from the main/UI thread.

        Parameters:
        url - - String representing the URL of the image
        inputStream - - InputStream opened from url
        Returns:
        CacheableBitmapDrawable which can be used to display the bitmap.

      • put

        public CacheableBitmapDrawable put(java.lang.String url,
                          byte[] data,
                          android.graphics.BitmapFactory.Options decodeOpts)
        Caches resulting bitmap from data for url into all enabled caches. This version of the method should be preferred as it allows the original image contents to be cached, rather than a re-compressed version.

        The contents of the array will be decoded into a Bitmap, using the optional decodeOpts. Providing the decode worked:

        • If the memory cache is enabled, the decoded Bitmap will be cached to memory.
        • If the disk cache is enabled, a temporay version of the contents is copied to disk before decoding and then cached to disk.

        You should not call this method from the main/UI thread.

        Parameters:
        url - - String representing the URL of the image
        data - - Raw data opened from url
        decodeOpts - - Options used for decoding. This does not affect what is cached in the disk cache (if enabled).
        Returns:
        CacheableBitmapDrawable which can be used to display the bitmap.

      • put

        public CacheableBitmapDrawable put(java.lang.String url,
                          java.io.InputStream inputStream,
                          android.graphics.BitmapFactory.Options decodeOpts)
        Caches resulting bitmap from inputStream for url into all enabled caches. This version of the method should be preferred as it allows the original image contents to be cached, rather than a re-compressed version.

        The contents of the InputStream will be copied to a temporary file, then the file will be decoded into a Bitmap, using the optional decodeOpts. Providing the decode worked:

        • If the memory cache is enabled, the decoded Bitmap will be cached to memory.
        • If the disk cache is enabled, the contents of the original stream will be cached to disk.

        You should not call this method from the main/UI thread.

        Parameters:
        url - - String representing the URL of the image
        inputStream - - InputStream opened from url
        decodeOpts - - Options used for decoding. This does not affect what is cached in the disk cache (if enabled).
        Returns:
        CacheableBitmapDrawable which can be used to display the bitmap.

      • remove

        public void remove(java.lang.String url)
        Removes the entry for url from all enabled caches, if it exists.

        If you have the disk cache enabled, you should not call this method from main/UI thread.

      • removeFromMemoryCache

        public void removeFromMemoryCache(java.lang.String url)
        Removes the entry for url from memory, if it exists.

      • removeFromDiskCache

        public void removeFromDiskCache(java.lang.String url)
        Removes the entry for url from disk cache, if it exists.

        You should not call this method from main/UI thread.

      • resizeMemoryForTiles

        public void resizeMemoryForTiles(int numberOfTiles)

      • trimMemory

        public void trimMemory()
        This method iterates through the memory cache (if enabled) and removes any entries which are not currently being displayed. A good place to call this would be from Application.onLowMemory().
